key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris aims to focus on addressing the root causes of migration from Central America, rather than managing the US southern border itself.
President Joe Biden tasked Harris with leading efforts with Mexico and the Northern Triangle countries to stem migration.
Harris and her team are concerned about being politically linked to the border situation, fearing it could be damaging.
Criticism from Republican critics and the media has portrayed Harris' immigration role as a border assignment.
Harris is preparing for a trip to Guatemala and Mexico to discuss issues driving Central American migration to the US.
Her role includes securing commitments from private companies to invest in the Northern Triangle countries.
Officials and experts assert that addressing migration causes can't be separated from the situation at the US-Mexico border.
The pandemic and economic downturn have exacerbated migration from Latin America to the US.
Harris is deemed a key figure for the Democratic Party in the 2024 presidential race and is keen on fulfilling her newly assigned task.
She has engaged with immigration advocates and regional experts to gather a wide range of information on addressing the migration issue.
